intro: Megastachya cylindrica, commonly known as the cylindrical beakvane, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its tall, slender stems and showy, bell-shaped flowers. The plant produces cylindrical, spike-like inflorescences that are often pink or purple in color. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a popular choice for xeriscaping. Its unique appearance and drought tolerance make it an attractive addition to native plant gardens.
